__comment: PARAMETERS
size to use for final volumes
suffix for files
number of samples for point clouds
where to find the dataset and where to put the fraction chosen
contains the models for each training/training_inference set
fraction of original training set to take (randomly)
MESH PRE-PROCESSING
rotation along y axis
the meshes are aligned, but usually directed in the direction of the x axis
i.e. the length of the car corresponds to the x axis
to change this, the models can be rotated along the y axis
padding in unit cube applied to the largest dimension (i.e. dimension with the largest
extents of the CAD model
whether to flip all random versions
number of random versions of each CAD model
noise of scale, i.e. scale is changed randomly in [1 - scale_noise, 1 + scale_noise]
noise around the center, i.e. the origin
in low resolutions, an angle of 45 degrees may look skewed
this is the rotation for the meshes, for the rendering, a separate rotation
is possible which allows to have observations from all sides while the
model itself is always oriented similarly
maximum rotation around the x axis in degrees
maximum rotation around the y axis in degrees
maximum rotation around the z axis in degrees
RENDERING PRE-PROCESSING
randomly sampled rotations for rendering
the y rotation allows to 'observe' the car from different sides while
the model itself is always oriented similarly
note that different tools might operate in different coordinate systems
for example, librender has a camera centered at (0, 0, 0) looking in the direction of (0, 0, 1)
intrinsic camera parameters for rendering
use this animation to set the paramters: http://ksimek.github.io/2013/08/13/intrinsic/
note that paramters also need t match z_near, z_far, max_depth_value and mesh_center for good results
focal length can be 1.5*image_width and 2.5*image_height
image size for rendering
depth is rendered between z_near and z_far;
as the mesh lives in (-0.5 to 0.5, -0.5 to 0.5, -0.5 to 0.5) and is moved to mesh_center (see below)
z_near and z_far are usually mesh_center_z +- 0.5
max_depth_value should then correspond to a number between z_near and z_far, usually z_far
'nearest' depth value
'farthest' depth value
maximum depth value used to distinguish background from object
corresponds to z_far above or a value below that
also see librender/pyrender.pyx for details!
translation used from (0, 0, 0) centered mesh to the center in front of the camera
the farther away, the higher the resolution should be for appropriate resolution of point clouds
lambda of en exponential distribution to add random noise to the depth values
probability of ignoring a ray, i.e. go through the ray with maximum depth
distance function truncation value
level used for filling
FILE NAMES
all directory and file names are suffixed by
the height, width, depth of the volumes
directory holding the raw OFF files of the generated cuboids as outputed from
cuboid generation, see above
directory for scaled, gt meshes
h5 file for points sampled from scaled, gt mesh
directory for scaled, gt point clouds
h5 file for the depth maps
h5 file for rendering rotations
h5 file for filled voxelized cuboids
h5 file for voxelized point clouds and corresponding distance transforms
h5 file for voxelized free space and corresponding distance transforms
h5 file for signed distance functions
